repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Russia Ozone Depleting
            Substance Consumption Phaseout Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Russia Ozone Depleting Substance
            Consumption Phase-out Project had the following ratings: the
            outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that The
            Project provides an example of successfully integrating
            global environmental objectives. The project underlines the
            importance of the quality of preparation and appraisal in
            being able to deliver the integrated global environmental
            and local objectives in a cost effective manner. The project
            demonstrates the value of a well resourced and experienced
            Ozone Operations Resource Group (PIU). It demonstrates a
            strong correlation between enterprise commitment and the
            ultimate success of investment sub-projects. This Project
            provides an example of the supervision intensive nature of
            operations involving multiple, technically diverse and
            complex investment sub-projects as well as supporting
            technical assistance. The project also provides insight into
            the general issue of sustaining government commitment.
            Project design should be made as robust and flexible as
            possible to sustain major external shocks that are the rule
            in Countries with Economies in Transition (CEITs), where
            institutional instability and the impacts of rapid and
            unpredictable market economy transition is occurring.

5084054.trustfund:
TF028314-GEF1-RUSSIA ODS CONSUMPTION
            PHASE-OUT PROJECT,TF034109-RUSSIA - OZONE DEPLETING
            SUBSTANCE CONSUMPTION PHASE OUT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Ozone Depleting
            Substance Consumption Phase-out Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of the Ozone
            Depleting Substance Consumption Phase-out Project is to
            assist Russia in the phase-out of ozone depleting substances
            (ODS) consumption, in a manner consistent with international
            efforts in the field, while ensuring that this is
            accomplished with the minimum of economic dislocation. The
            project's more specific objectives are to: 1) allow
            Russia to credibly initiate meeting its ODS consumption
            phase-out obligations under the Montreal Protocol on
            Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer (MP) within a
            realistic time frame; 2) facilitate access to financial
            resources needed for ODS consumption phase-out from a range
            of international and domestic sources; 3) provide necessary
            technical assistance and institutional strengthening; 4)
            fund enterprise specific investments in critical high
            consumption sectors; and 5) ensure that ODS phase-out
            activities accommodate economic and social impacts that may
            result. The project will consist of the following
            components: 1) investment for ODS phase-out in the aerosol
            sector; 2) investment for ODS phase-out in the refrigeration
            sector; 3) technical assistance and institutional
            strengthening; and 4) a sub-grant processing component.
